Reviews.Title: “It was okay.”
Reviews.Author: Umair I
Reviews.Content: No big complaints. Breakfast was included, which was alright. EasyJet website advertised it as a 4 star, when it is much more like a 3 star hotel. Rooms were quite stuffy at night, there might be a problem with the air circulation. The gym was closed though, for some reason. They refused to let us in with inadequate explanation.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel rate and location.”
Reviews.Author: Luciano M
Reviews.Content: Hotel nearby lots of public transportation options. Staff not to friendly and hard to find English speakers. Wi-fi and airco not working properly. Breakfast was just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and breakfast...ordinary everything else”
Reviews.Author: Rupertpb
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good convenient location and offers a vast buffet breakfast, but everything else about it is just ordinary. Rooms are serviceable and well, nothing much else. In mine, the air conditioning did not work, and WIFI was very very difficult to long on to. There was just nothing exceptional about this hotel. Service ranged from big smiles to bigger frowns. I think it is a good bet if you can get a really good deal here. There is nothing outstandingly bad or good (well, there is the location and breakfast...), so the reason to stay here in my opinion would be a really good deal on the room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and close to the old town”
Reviews.Author: Kardoesie
Reviews.Content: We arrived by shuttle from the airport as part of the Turkish Airlines booking â€“ a free shuttle and free accommodation for one night. The welcome was warm and the service was good. The staff helped me with some Turkish words and were very encouraging. The room was spotless and spacious with a view. The air-con did not work properly, but I opened the window. The en-suit bathroom was clean. The clean, white towels were of good quality. Breakfast is VERY substantial with a buffet with fresh fruit and juices, pastries, breads, salads, vegetables, soups, hot and cold foods, cheeses, yoghurts â€“ YUM! There is an excellent sweet pastry shop around the corner. The hotel is a stone throw from the tram line, which I took on recommendation of the hotel staff. It is easy enough to buy coupons. I travelled several times on the tram to the Spice Market, to the opposite coast, to dinner, to a hamami, and to the Grand Bazaar. The highlights were my Turkish bath at the Cagaloglu hamami (what a treat!) and the visit to the spice market - where one can buy tea, sweets, coffee, pastries, etc. And make sure to eat at the world famous Pandeli restaurant at the spice market. Restaurants are good, street stalls are great for fresh juice, tea or Turkish coffee & pastries. Everywhere people helped me to acquire more Turkish words and phrases â€“ so friendly and welcoming. I loved the central location and extensive breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: WidthAdventures
Reviews.Content: A Turkish airline delay caused me to miss my flight to the US and they paid for me to stay the night at this hotel. One reception person spoke English well enough to communicate what was necessary. The room was nothing special, but adequate and clean. The hotel is not near many sites, but the neighborhood seemed safe with quite a bit of non-touristy shopping available very nearby. The public transportation system was within 1/2 block and likely would have taken you wherever you may need to go. Since this stay was unintentional and only overnight I did not futher explore that option. The breakfast buffet was very extensive with coffee, tea, juice, two soups, many cheeses, cold meats, cereal, jams, pastries, bread, eggs, potatoes, and a few other items that were supposed to be warm. My only real complaint would be that the staff in the breakfast buffet area seemed less than pleased to be working there and the food items that were supposed to be hot were cold and most items that were supposed to be cold were warm. There is quite a bit of traffic in this area, but once I closed my window the noise was very minimal. Overall an adequate stay, no real complaints.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints!”
Reviews.Author: YJE06
Reviews.Content: Goodness, what was all the fuss about? My friend and I stayed at this hotel and had NO complaints. The breakfast buffet was extensive - from soup (?!) to scrambled eggs and everything in between. The room was absolutely fine - not the Ritz, granted - but then we didnt pay Ritz prices. The bathroom and shower were adequate and we had no complaints about the staff. The aircon wasnt particularly effective, but then we were on the 4th floor so just opened the window! This hotel is right between tram stops, although we walked into Istanbul each day; there is a little bar down the street a little towards Istanbul which had a live quartet of musicians playing turkish music and the staff were both friendly and welcoming; as two ladies travelling on our own we thought we might be hassled, but we found everyone absolutely charming. GO! Its a great city. Dont miss Vogue restaurant for the views, or a traditional Hammam for an amazing experience. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Never stay at this awful hotel...”
Reviews.Author: sunshe_10
Reviews.Content: We missed our flight because of Turkish Airlines' postpones and they settled us down to this hotel for two days stay. First, the hotel room was older than my great great grandma. Next, the bed felt like sleeping on top of a stone and last they said every meal was compansated, yet they didn't allow us to drink a cup of tea...only water was allowed...Don't stay at this hotel..it doesn't deserve even two stars and the receptionist was rude. Whoever misses their flight was sent here to suffer I guess...so watch out..

Reviews.Title: “disgraceful service and Rude staff”
Reviews.Author: crikeyLondon
Reviews.Content: Rooms were ok but the staff of this hotel were a disgrace to the hotel industry. They were very rude so if you want to ruin your holiday this is the place to start with. If they were based in euorpe i am sure a few lawsuit s would be filed against the owners of this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The worst ever, dont stay there!”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa-Spain
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Istanbul, with a flight at the midlle of the night, 4 AM. The hotel was booked and "they could not find our reservation", which was very ironic, since it was done and confirmed with them previoulsly. They were not even intrested to make up and ofer us a different room just for that night, in fact since it was booked they were using the escuse that there were no managers there, to authorize them. The city, was booked and we had to wait until 10:30AM, and obvioulsly ruined one day of our 3 days there. The room is also very bad: street noise, the pillows are hard, the light in the morning wakes you up, the towells very old and hard, and the reception employees VERY rude. This is not a 4 starts, dont stay there!

Reviews.Title: “A bit further out but clean, friendly and enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: lnlondon26
Reviews.Content: I don't really understand the negative views of previous reviewers. I haev just come back from a 5 day trip to Istanbul and was very apprehensive about the hotel as a result of previous reviews. I needn't have worried. So the Grand Anka isn't in the centre of town. But it is right by the tram which takes no more than 10 mins to get to the Aya Sofya, Blue Mosque and Grand Bazar. The local surroundings had plenty of cafes and shops and felt safe at all times. Whilst our air conditioning didn't work very well, the bedroom was really spacious, the beds comfortable and we had a TV with hundreds of channels including about three english speaking channels. The reception staff were lovely, they would remember our room number so that we never had to ask for our key and delivered our departure information to our room. If you want to be right in the centre then this isn't the hotel for you but I would definitely recommend it for value and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel....”
Reviews.Author: chaku24
Reviews.Content: I did not like the hotel and the front desk... They were very rude and not a clean hotel... I would not even rate the hotel.....

Reviews.Title: “Average "coach party" hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bugsy47
Reviews.Content: We had 2 stays of 3 nights on tour in a small group. The staff and reception were generally helpful and welcoming, rooms functional and clean, beds on the hard side but not uncomfortable for us. One room, 306, had a pervasive smell, malfunctioning aircon, and no English speaking channel on TV. 307 was better and had CNN in English. It may be difficult to reach this hotel by public transport to and from the airport. Although it is near a frequent tram stop, the trams are sometimes very packed so luggage might be difficult. As others have mentioned, there's nothing much to do in the immediate vicinity. Breakfast was good and had lots of variety, though the "hot food" didn't look appetising. Usually fresh butter was served over ice. On 2 mornings we had small packets of butter which smelled of and tasted like blue stilton! However the hotel is used by large tour groups so if you come down after a group has been through ie. after 7.30pm there may not be much left. The restaurant food was repetitive mass catering with "hot food" sometimes served cold. On one occasion half our group sent their main meal back. They only serve meat, no fish. For our last meal they did make an effort, and it was better, but I guess they can get away with lower standards where there is a fast turnover of customers. The "no smoking" policy was generally but not always enforced. The only alcohol served was beer which appeared to be relatively low in alcohol. I was as happy on water!

Reviews.Title: “rude staff”
Reviews.Author: scooterReno_NV
Reviews.Content: I asked the staff to look for my daughter's lost pajamas very politely, multiple times and used pictures, diagrams to supplement my poor Turkish. Despite telling me many times they would call my room, they never did. They also ruined my clothes in the laundry and charged a fortune. Good luck if you are not with a Turkish speaking male.

Reviews.Title: “good location, rooms clean”
Reviews.Author: zebras4me
Reviews.Content: I booked this as a package deal and the website said it was a four star hotel. I read the reviews and was a bit apprehensive. The staff are helpful. Whenever we asked them a question, they were always polite. I mean how much dealing do you have with hotel staff anyway??? The breakfast in the morning was okay too. Our rooms were cleaned everyday and the room was clean on arrival too. True it is not in the center of Istanbul however the tram station is less than five mins away and it takes less than 15 mins to go to the centrer. The only bad point I would mention is the beds were too hard for me. The other people I was staying with said they were okay. For this reason alone, I would not stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Location, Bad Hotel and Even Worse Staff”
Reviews.Author: rainman123
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying that I have travelled to over 30 countries World wide and stayed in over 250 hotels but this hotel ranks as one of the worst. To start with the location is terrible, is is well in excess of 3km from any of the attractions, and if you want to walk, please do not do it at night. I am a big guy and have been to some rough places but this is a joke, even I did not feel safe. When you first walk intro the lobby you feel ok but as soon as you speak to the staff you start to feel like you have made a mistake. They just do not seem to care that you are there. The rooms are small and they have a weird smell to them, and lack the ameinaties that any basic 4 star hotel in europe has. Including air con that works. One other problem was that any public area in the hotel was way to hot even for February. On our last evening we decided to get a beer in the hotel, the problem with this is it was very warm in the bar to start with and then the beer came even warmer. To sum things up, all I can say is stay away from this hotel at all costs, and if youi really want to go to Istanbul go to a diffrent area.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the tram station”
Reviews.Author: tourtoturkey
Reviews.Content: Grand Anka has a large lobby and a cosy bar. That it is located some kilometeres from the main attractions-St.Sophia and Blue Mosque- must not be a problem since it is very close to the tram station. It is nice experience to take the tram.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: SilviaY
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel back in March and found it a bit far from the local attractions however it was conveniently located, just a about one block from the nearest tram stop. The rooms were a good size and clean. The staff friendliness more than made up for all the niggling things that did not work: the fridge door was broken and our TV only picked up 1 channel and the volume was set at high! We advised the reception and someone came to check it out but it did not work properly for the whole stay. We ate in the restaurant and it was a bit pricey and not very appetising. The breakfast was on the contrary very nice and it there was a good choice of local produce.

HotelInfo.Name: Grand Anka Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Molla Gurani Street 46 | Findikzade, Istanbul 34093, Turkey
